definition: to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: Each embroidery is designed step by step.
sentences.chinese: 将描图纸打洞是刺绣设计的前置步骤。

sentences.english: Vellum paper with a glazed surface is used for decorative documents.
sentences.chinese: 是厚的描图纸，尤其方便用在针笔线图上。
这个绘图员描图的技术好。

sentences.english: To illustrate the result of identification.
White tracing paper should be used on fabric.
sentences.chinese: 把白色的描图纸放在面料上。

sentences.english: Vellum is a thick tracing paper stock, good for line drawing.
sentences.chinese: 是厚的描图纸，尤其方便用在针笔线图上。

sentences.english: The illustrations look as though a teenager copied an image using tracing paper.
sentences.chinese: 看起来就像一个十几岁复制图像使用描图纸的插图。

sentences.english: Mastering tools, marking tools and miscellaneous tools are newest products too.
sentences.chinese: 品，还有测量工具描图工作和其它工作都是最新产品。
这个绘图员描图的技术好。

definition: to make a draft/to draft (a document)
to draw designs, maps etc/picture (e.g. of life in the city)
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
to draw a rectangular grid (e.g. of farmland)/to checker
paper pattern as model in dressmaking/paper patten
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
to trace over red characters (as a method of learning to write)
inked line/carpenter's straight line marker (an inked cord stretched tight then lowered onto timber)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
